EmailTemplate.textOnly: - - - 110 Clean Clean false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE MicrosoftInternetExplorer4 Steve, My guess is that your client is nudging (or forcing) you to go through a 3rd party. The reason why they are doing this is because of IRS misclassification. I’m sure you’ve heard all about it. Companies are raising the ‘vendor bar’ for working directly (otherwise we wouldn’t be having this conversation). Paying via 1099 makes no sense, because that doesn’t achieve the client’s goals of having taxes withheld (which is ultimately the IRS goal in their mad purist of going after as many companies as possible) – hence why the bar is being raised. You can deduct everything you could before with the exception of home office (as % of your mortgage), lease on a car, and depreciation of large assets. If you want to do those, you still can. When you file your schedule C (I’m assuming you have your own LLC), then you just enter it as non-employer reimbursed expense (assuming it’s more than 2.5% of your AGI). You don’t lose the deduction, it’s just not as convenient as running the expense through us – just do it on your own. We actually used to allow our members to write this off, but we had so many people who were submitting the expense without actually qualifying (since we have no way of easily substantiating). If you need to get on a W2 for your client, we are going to be – without question the best way to net the most. You won’t find another service that will allow you to take business and medical deductions on a W2 and you certainly won’t find one that lets you retain more of your rate after tax caps are hit. Feel free to search around and talk with other umbrella companies – we’ll be here once you realize how strong our value prop is. Other perks:1. Retirement plan (401k and Roth 401k)2. If you do any brokering or contract placements, we can pay the workers you place, collect their time, invoice, etc..3. Professional Insurances (business, E&O) – when you use us you don’t have to carry these anymore.
